homes_hear_details: Iowa's HOMES and HEAR programs are pending launch. The Iowa Economic Development Authority is developing program plans and implementation timelines using approximately $45 million in IRA funding allocated to the state.
state_energy_office: Iowa Economic Development Authority - Energy Office

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For a family of four in Des Moines, 80% AMI is approximately $62,400. Low-income households will qualify for the highest rebate levels under HOMES when the program launches.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For a family of four in Des Moines, 150% AMI is approximately $117,000. Moderate-income households will qualify for partial rebates under HOMES when the program launches.

net_metering: Iowa requires investor-owned utilities to offer net metering under the state's alternate energy production (AEP) facility rules. Systems up to 500 kW qualify. Excess generation is credited at the utility's avoided cost rate. Municipal and cooperative utilities may have different policies.

state_tax_credits.name: Iowa Solar Energy System Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: 15% of the federal solar tax credit amount (effectively 4.5% of installed cost), capped at $5,000 for residential
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar PV and solar thermal systems installed on residential or commercial properties in Iowa
state_tax_credits.details: The credit is refundable and claimed in the year the system is placed in service. Must be installed by a certified installer. Applications must be submitted before installation begins. The program has an annual cap, so credits are awarded on a first-come, first-served basis.

state_rebate_programs.name: Iowa Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Iowa Economic Development Authority / Local Community Action Agencies
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Air sealing, insulation, furnace repair and replacement, water heater replacement, window and door repairs
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to households at or below 200% of the federal poverty level. No cost to qualifying residents.

programs.name: MidAmerican Energy HomeCheck Program
programs.amount: Free home energy assessment plus $50-$1,500 in rebates depending on measures
programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, duct sealing, high-efficiency HVAC, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR windows

programs.name: MidAmerican Energy HVAC Rebates
programs.amount: $200-$1,200 depending on equipment type and efficiency
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency furnaces, central air conditioners, heat pumps, ductless mini-splits

programs.name: Alliant Energy Residential Rebates
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, central air conditioners, furnaces, insulation, smart thermostats, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: Alliant Energy Home Energy Assessment
programs.amount: Free or low-cost assessment with instant savings measures installed
programs.eligible_items: Home energy audit, LED bulbs, smart power strips, faucet aerators, showerheads

programs.name: Black Hills Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency furnaces, water heaters, insulation, smart thermostats
